author: Staff Reporter
text:
Suresh Prabhu inaugurates project in Wallajahbad

“The common user rail auto hub at Wallajahbad will become functional soon,” Vashishta Johri, general manager, Southern Railway said on Tuesday.

Once completed, it will tap the export market through competitive pricing. The official was speaking to reporters on the occasion of the project’s inauguration by Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu through video conferencing from New Delhi on Tuesday. With the setting up of the project, the Southern Railway has set its sights on the export market potential from the Chennai and Ennore ports.

Around 3.50 lakh units of cars, out of 10 lakh units manufactured at automobile industries in Maraimalai Nagar, Singaperumal Koil, Oragadam and Sriperumbudur are being exported every year through the two ports.

The cars are now being transported to these two ports by road and it takes multiple trips for automobile companies to finish the delivery of the cars. With the creation of the rail auto hub, around 500 cars could be moved to the port in one trip, which would be beneficial to the manufacturers, Mr. Johri said. Talks with manufacturers have also been initiated to tap the inland traffic by offering logistics service to destinations in other States, the official added.
title: Rail auto hub to give leg up to car exports
